duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise substation equipment reliability needs and environmental compliance activities for commercial operations.
Establish and monitor system-wide substation NERC compliance testing policy.
Coordinate special testing services for power stations equipment and system protection.
Provide technical analysis of testing results for dissolved gas in oil analysis, relays, and major electrical equipment.
Determine levels of spare substation equipment transformers, breakers, regulators, bushings, coupling capacitors, relays, and lighting arrestors.
Coordinate review and evaluation of project authorization and operating one-line diagrams.
Authorize routine and emergency movement of major substation equipment, transformers, circuit breakers, and regulators.
Work with contract service providers on transformer assemblies and processing.
Prepare bids, evaluate proposals, and review completed work.
Ensure compliance with environmental regulations governing commercial operations.
Support PJM committees for substation or system protection activities.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field (Master's preferred)
Completion of the Electrical Equipment Training Program
